title: Honoring Rhonda Faulkner upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the Community Person of the Year Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Rhonda Faulkner upon the occasion of her
designation  as  recipient  of the Community Person of the Year Award by
the Bellmore Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and  serve  the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS,  Rhonda  Faulkner  of Phoenix Medical Billing and Consultants
has given not only of her time and energies but also of her  competence,
intelligence  and  leadership  and  consequently has been designated for
special recognition; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Rhonda  Faulk-
ner  upon  the occasion of her designation as recipient of the Community
Person of the Year Award by the Bellmore Chamber of Commerce to be cele-
brated at its Annual Installation Dinner on January 29, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Rhonda Faulkner has been called upon to contribute  her  time
and  talents  to countless civic and charitable endeavors and has always
given of herself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS, Rhonda Faulkner is a firm believer that no one should ever go
hungry and she has never been one to ignore the less fortunate;  whether
it  has  been  donating her time to feeding the hungry in homeless shel-
ters, making and handing out sandwiches for her  Temple  or  taking  the
time out to walk into a deli and purchase a complete meal for a homeless
man sitting on the curb just begging for spare change; and
  WHEREAS,  Holiday  time  is  supposed to be a magical time of year for
everyone; Rhonda Faulkner used to dress up  like  a  Christmas  Elf  and
deliver  toys  to  children in hospitals and more recently, for the past
few years, she has been disguising herself as 'Santa' and answering  the
letters of thousands of children; and
  WHEREAS, Although these children are writing in with prayers for their
parents  to  get better or to find work, and all they want for Christmas
is for their father to have a new sweater or their mother to have a  new
cooking pot so she can make dinner, Rhonda Faulkner will send those in a
box  along  with  age appropriate toys and clothes for the author of the
letter and any siblings they may have; and
  WHEREAS, When she found out donations of school supplies  were  needed
for  children  whose families could not afford them, Rhonda Faulkner put
together almost 50 kits that included  a  notebook,  pencils  and  pens,
highlighters, a ruler, erasers, a pencil sharpener, a box of crayons and
a pencil box to store all the supplies; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to donating what little spare time she does have,
Rhonda  Faulkner  has  been able to create for herself a very successful
medical billing and consulting company that literally began in the base-
ment of her house; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the entire period  of  her  community  service,  a
period  of  constructive involvement, Rhonda Faulkner has stood constant
in dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by individuals
for the benefit of others which Rhonda Faulkner has displayed throughout
her life; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance  the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown a
long and sustained commitment to excellence certainly  have  earned  the
recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Rhonda Faulkner upon the occasion of her designation as  recipient

of  the  Community  Person  of the Year Award by the Bellmore Chamber of
Commerce; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Rhonda Faulkner.
